tsutaeyou
Dawn comes softer than a sleeping breath
Your dream runs through the forest now
You wake up and stir to find the light
If you have lost it, I will find it for you
It is hidden in our future
Now if we joined hands
we could go far away without letting go
In the memory of a far off day
the story of the blue country bloomed
Shining eyes
Your singing voice
Let us share it
The other star has arrived!
A round of applause for this brave merchant!
Wolf and Unbridged Divide
I repeat my declaration!
I shall repay the debt that that is shouldered by the traveling nun.
And when she has been granted freedom...
By the name of St. Lambardos who watches over the Rowen Trading Guild from above,
I swear that I shall profess my sincere love to her!
Horo already told me of her misfortune and the how she has been treated.
I will use my social standing and fortunes to restore the feathers of freedom to her,
and then propose to her.
A seal of blood, and that knife.
You are serious, are not you?
Even if her debt is paid off, Horo will not necessarily stop traveling with me.
I am confident that she will.
Furthermore, Horo is, while not perfect, still a nun.
Marriage is
Horo does not belong to any convent.
Because she is just a nun out of convenience while traveling,
she is not bound by the clergy to any oaths forbidding marriage.
You have done your homework.
According to Kumerson city law, when a woman is in debt, her guardian holds the rights as creditor.
If you were to unconditionally accede to my marriage proposal,
we could settle this without a contract.
Lawrence.
Will you take the contract knife?
Do not run away, Lawrence!
That would be shameful as a man!
Let me see the contract.
1000 Trenni silver?
I will repay you the sum that Horo owes you before evening tomorrow.
There is no mistake in the expiry period, right?
Correct.
1000 Trenni silver in cash.
I will not accept any bargaining or loans.
Agreed.
Understood.
Then the contract is established.
We will meet here again tomorrow, then.
There is no need to worry.
For something as trivial as having her debts paid,
my companion will not be swayed.
Alright!
Double for Lawrence, four times for Amarty!
5 Iredo on Lawrence!
I am putting 12 Iredo on you too!
Bartose.
It seems you have gotten involved in something troublesome.
Seriously.
I believe Amarty has come up with a way to make good on the money.
And likely,
not a particularly tasteful way either.
It would be too pitiable for Amarty if I were to help you too much, so I will not go into the details.
I just wanted to let you know.
Why?
Because no matter the reason, having someone to travel with is a happy thing.
Having that taken from you would be too harsh.
So then?
What will you do if that boy hands over the 1000 silver?
After settling the money you have spent, I would give you the rest.
Do not test me.
If Amarty is able to complete the contract, I would hold up my end of the deal.
Oh?
Quite a bit of confidence you have.
It is not confidence.
I simply trust in you.
Geez...
You are much cuter when you are panicking.
I am quite impressed with how much I have grown, myself.
You think you are grown-up because you stay calm and composed?
Am I wrong?
If you simply analyze the odds, then find they are in your favor and act all smug...
That is just plain scheming.
Call it a merchant's skill.
Refusing Amarty's contract would also have been an elegant way out, would not it?
That is...
I am sure you made your decision after judging the reactions of the onlookers, right?
Let us think about how it would be if our roles were reversed.
Reversed?
I want to stay by Lawrence's side forever!
Even though I am in debt, it is a bond that connects the two of us.
I would not be able to endure that link being severed.
Even if I am to be put to shame right here,
I cannot accept that contract.
What do you think?
T-That is definitely a manly way of handling it, but whether it is grown-up or not is a different matter.
Well, while it is true I would be happy, that is only something a youngster without regard for consequences would say.
It would be overdoing it.
If you think about it that way, maybe manly behavior and grown-up behavior cannot mix.
A proper man appears childish, and a proper grown-up appears cowardly.
In that case, how would the womanly and grown-up sage wolf Horo respond to that situation?
I would smile and take it, of course.
And then after accepting the contract and returning to the inn,
I would kneel like this.
I am sure you agreed because you thought it was a good gamble,
but you will undoubtedly make additional moves in the shadow.
Like back door dealings and misinformation?
You want me to take you to the festival, right?
A merchant would not hesitate to bribe in order to fulfill a contract, right?
Are you sure that is okay?
Taking the rumored beauty around with you?
If I kept her locked up in the inn, I would really look like I was using her debt to tie her down.
That is the whole truth.
I really am bound by the fetters of an enormous debt.
These chains are so heavy that I could not escape no matter what.
If you could undo them for me, I would be happy to dirty myself with flour.
No wonder Amarty fell head over heels.
The real one being tied down is definitely Lawrence.
Master!
Good work!
So, how was it?
Right.
Um... there is 200 Iredo in taxes recorded in the tax ledger.
Which means, as far as the city council is aware of,
Amarty has about 800 Trenni silver worth of assets.
What kind of gambling is there here?
Cards, dice, and Hare and Hounds
Note: Wiki Hare and Hounds (Board Game)
There
Is also a limit on the stakes.
Speaking of gambling, I heard that in the case that Amarty wins, there is also bets on which one of you will win after that.
I see.
Right now you have the advantage at a 1.2 to 1 payoff.
It is pretty close.
I should have the banker share some of the earnings with me.
So, what is the real situation like?
Even when there is an answer, there are some questions in this world that cannot be answered easily.
For instance,
the purity of that flour.
What would I do if my debts were cleared?
That is what you want to ask, right?
W-Well, that would be unreasonable.
But if that is the case, the only thing we can do is observe the opponent's actions directly.
How sneaky.
Call it an underwater battle.
After all, he will definitely send people to watch my every move as well.
I wonder about that.
I heard that Amarty was originally the heir of a rich family.
He left home and came to this remote region, with a will as strong as his sense for profit.
He looks down on the way the rest of us form connections with other merchants in town.
He made it this far on his own strength.
He is almost like a heroic knight.
That is true.
Maybe that is exactly why he fell for a charming nun.
After all, the women of town have an even stronger bond amongst themselves than we do.
They do not take well to outsiders.
I do not think he would be able to deal with that.
It is admirable.
But I am a merchant.
I am free to make use of my connections.
It may be sneaky for a knight, but in a battle between merchants there are no such complaints.
In the meantime, could you continue gathering information?
Bartose seems to think Amarty has a way to collect the funds.
If the contract goes unfulfilled, you will not have to continue worrying about it.
And if all goes well,
I just might be able to make a profit from Amarty's scheme.
Was not that a shepherd's horn just now?
It was.
It would not normally be blown in town.
If that shepherdess girl had followed us here, what would you do?
Nothing much.
I would just greet her with How unexpected!.
If you do not get flustered then it looks like I am trying to win you over.
Well that is just delightful.
So much so that it is scary.
Oh right, the festival just started.
Shall we go then?
Just eating is boring.
I cannot see...
This way!
We get front-row seats!
We should thank Amarty for this.
What a splendid act.
And the atmosphere is not bad.
Let us join them!
Alright!
Be careful not to step on my feet.
I will try not to.
What is next?
Bed's next.
Just a little further.
Bed...
Will you be gentle to me?
Idiot.
Pardon me.
A letter from Mark arrived for you while you were out.
From Mark?
It can wait till tomorrow.
Or maybe not...
Sorry for waking you.
I need to go meet Mark again for a bit.
With a female-scented letter hidden in your jacket?
This is... um...
Is there anything else you are hiding from me?
Actually, yesterday, I met with someone familiar with legends from the north and asked about Yoitsu.
She happened to be a woman.
And then?
I got some worthwhile information from her.
I also heard a story about you.
Me?
Y-Yes.
There was a legend about you in Renose.
We called her'Horou of the wheaten tail'.
That is you, right?
I do not know.
The legend spoke about which direction you came from.
Are you serious?
Y-Yeah.
It seems you came from a forest east of Renose.
Southwest of Niohira and east of Renose, in the mountains, is apparently where Yoitsu is located.
Were you hiding that so you could surprise me later?
I wish you had told me sooner.
Sorry.
When all we knew was that it was southwest of Niohira, it would have been hard to find.
But with this, we have narrowed it down quite a bit.
I expect this letter holds additional information.
At this rate, we might arrive sooner than I expected.
I see.
If we got to Niohira, would not you be able to go back alone?
Even if it takes half a year, let us do our best to find it together.
I will going to go see Mark now, then.
With that female-scented letter in your pocket?
You are pretty relaxed for someone who is asking others to help out.
Right, Lawrence?
Though, I do have a lot of free time during the festival.
And I am making quite a bit thanks to you.
You took advantage of it?
What is the scheme?
It was easy money, I raked it in.
I knew as soon as you said Bartose had an idea of what the scheme was.
Precious stones?
Close, but not quite.
You would not really call what we are dealing in precious stones.
Pyrite?
Oh, you already knew?
It is about the fortune telling, is not it?
Yeah.
But that that fellow's not in town any more.
Supposedly she attracted the attention of the Inquisition.
The town would be in mayhem if the church had really come.
Exactly.
And there is too much pyrite going around.
I will bet she bought it in bulk from some town and disappeared once it sold out.
And thanks to the fortune teller's sales pitch, the church is after them, so its value is skyrocketing.
How much do you think it is worth right now?
Let us see...
Guessing liberally, 100?
No way!
It is a stupid price, but when the market opens tomorrow I expect it will rise even more.
Even so, this goes for 270?
Even worthless junk, given a story that they have some effect, will go for a high price.
The women of the town are crazy about these right now.
They are competing over how much they can get wealthy traders and farmers to spend on the miracle stones.
Every time they plead the price goes up.
To think this would become such a huge business...
We are no longer talking about profit in mere percentages here.
We are talking several or even ten times the return.
Meaning that Amarty is likely raking in the money faster than lightning.
No way...
I only just got into it and I have already made 300 Iredo.
Nobody wants to let this one out on their watch.
Who else knows about this?
It seems to have spread throughout the marketplace this morning.
While you and the princess were dancing,
there was already a huge ruckus in front of the ore merchant stands.
I have failed as a merchant...
No, you can still pull through.
With all the merchants running amok for these, the prices have skyrocketed.
Besides,
if by chance you fail, you will have the money to buy a new princess, right?
Well, for now Ill be buying some of these from you using the credit from the nails.
By the way, are things really okay with you and the princess?
Amarty might just be able to buy out her debt.
No need to worry.
With the money from this deal, I will make more profit.
And then, chosen by the now-free princess, I will resume my journey.
That is quite some confidence.
Of course.
You... can read?
Hey...
What should I do?
I no longer have a home to go back to...
What should I do?
It is only an old story.
A lot of those legends are inaccurate.
Inaccurate?
Right.
Like when ruling forces change,
they often spread stories like that.
If that is the case,
why did not you say anything?
This topic... is just too sensitive.
When I read this I meant to tell you...
I just...
I have been running around carefree without knowing anything all this time...
It must have been fun for you to watch, right?
Horo...
What!
Please calm down.
My mind is going in circles.
You have known about Yoitsu all along, have not you?
I am right, are not I?
You knew it when we first met!
If so, that explains a lot of things.
Horo...
You...
like weak, pitiable lambs after all, do not you?
How did it feel listening to me talk about returning to my hometown, completely ignorant that it is already gone?
My foolishness must have been cute to you.
So pitiable that you loved it!
That is why you let me indulge myself and treated me kindly, right?
You told me to go back alone once we got to Niohira because you are already tired of me, right?
Horo!
I have become alone...
There is no one waiting for me at home anymore...
I have really become alone.
I am here, are not I?
What are you to me?
No...
What am I to you?
No...
I do not want to be alone anymore!
Horo...
Hey...
Would you mate with me?
Horo...
I am alone now...
But if I had a child, there would be two of us.
Look, I am in human form right now.
Hey, will not you
Do not say any more!
That is right!
You are that kind of man.
I did not expect anything from you to begin with!
That is right, I remember now.
There is someone who truly loves me.
You are not panicking because you know you are going to trade me for 1000 silver, right?
Right!?
Say something!
Sorry.
Wolf and End of Shallowness
